Mark correct option

choices.value: The expression 'postage' means the duty chargeable for the transmission by post of postal articles
The expression 'postage stamps' means any stamp provided by the [Central Government] for denoting postage or other fees or sums payable in respect of postal articles under this Act
The expression 'post office' includes every house, building, room, carriage or place used for the purposes of the Post Office

label: Meanings of 'in course of transmission by post' and 'delivery' for the purposes of this Act

choices.value: A postal article shall be deemed to be in course of transmission by the post from the time of its being delivered to a post office to the time of its being delivered to the addressee or of its being returned to the sender or otherwise disposed

A postal article shall be deemed to be in course of transmission by the post from the time of its being delivered to a post office to the time of its being delivered to the addressee or of its being returned to the sender or otherwise disposed
The delivery of a postal article at the house or office of the addressee, or to the addressee or his servant or agent or other person considered to be authorized to receive the article

label: Mark the correct option

choices.value: Common carriers of passengers or goods, and their servants or agents, except as regards letters solely concerning goods in their carts or carriages are forbidden to convey letter
Owners and masters of vessels sailing or passing on any river or canal in [India], or between any ports or places in [India] and their servants or agents are forbidden to convey of letter

Exemption from liability for loss, misdelivery, delay or damage.-The [Government] shall not incur any liability by reason of the loss, misdelivery or delay of, or damage to, any postal article in course of transmission by post

Penalty for misconduct of person employed to carry or deliver mail bags or postal articles.-Whoever, being employed to carry or deliver any mail bag or any postal article in course of transmission by post

choices.value: Punishable with fine which may extend to hundred rupees and 1 month imprisonment
Punishable with fine which may extend to fifty rupees
Punishable with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees
Punishable with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees

label: Whoever, being employed to carry or deliver any mail bag or any postal article in course of transmission by post, voluntarily withdraws from the duties of his office without permission or without having given one month's previous notice in writing

choices.value: Punishable with fine which may extend to fifty rupees
Punishable with imprisonment which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to hundred rupees, or with both
Punishable with imprisonment which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to fifty rupees, or with both.

label: Whoever, being employed to carry or deliver any postal article made any false entry in the register with intent to induce the belief that he has visited a place, or delivered a postal article, which he has not visited or delivered

choices.value: Whoever, being employed to carry or deliver any postal article made any false entry in the register with intent to induce the belief that he has visited a place, or delivered a postal article, which he has not visited or delivered
Punishable with fine which may extend to fifty rupees or with fine which may extend to one hundred rupees, or with both.
Punishable with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees

label: Whoever, being an officer of the post office, commits theft in respect of or dishonestly misappropriates, or for any purpose whatsoever, secretes, destroys or throws away, any postal article in course of transmission by post or anything contained therein, shall be punishable

choices.value: Punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one hundred rupees, or with both
Punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one hundred rupees, or with both
Punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one hundred rupees, or with both

label: Whoever, being an officer of the Post Office, contrary to this duty, opens, or causes or suffers to be opened, any postal article in course of transmission by post, or willfully details or delays

choices.value: Punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one hundred rupees, or with both.
Punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine or both.
Punishable with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees

label: Whoever, being an officer of the PO fraudulently puts any wrong official mark on a postal article or fraudulently alters, removes or causes to disappear an official mark which is on a postal article

choices.value: Punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one hundred rupees, or with both.
Punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine or both..
Punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, and shall also be punishable with fine

label: Penalty for fraudulently preparing, altering, secreting or destroying Post Office documents

choices.value: Punishable with fine which may extend to hundred rupees and 1 month imprisonment
Punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, and shall also be punishable with fine
Punishable with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees

Punishable with imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, and shall also be punishable with fine

Whoever, being required by IPO Act 1898 to make a declaration in respect of any postal article to be sent by post or the content or value thereof, make in his declaration any statement which he knows, or has reason to believe, to be false, or does not believe to be true, shall be punishable under Section 64 of the said act

choices.value: With fine which may extend to two hundred rupees
With imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months
With imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one hundred rupees
None of the above option is correct

The presence of an official of the Post Office concerned shall be prima facie evidence under the said Act
